title: The world’s most mysterious book - Stephen Bax

multiple-choice.question: What is the Voynich manuscript, and what makes it a mystery?

options.label: A
options.text: It's a 240-page book that's a mix of real and imaginary plants, castles, and astrology diagrams, but no one can figure out what it says.

options.label: B
options.text: It's a book written by a medieval con man that contains the knowledge of a forgotten culture.

options.label: C
options.text: It's a secret code deliberately designed to hide secret meaning.

options.label: D
options.text: It's a hoax written in gibberish to make money off a gullible buyer.

options.label: C
options.text: Rudolf II

options.label: D
options.text: Lev Vygotsky

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: The translation of the manuscript's text into a modern language.

multiple-choice.question: What might we find if we can crack the code of the Voynich manuscript?

options.label: C

multiple-choice.question: What is cognitive reserve, and how can it help prevent or delay the onset of Alzheimer's disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Cognitive reserve is the ability to remember more information, and it can help prevent Alzheimer's disease by reducing the amount of amyloid plaques in the brain

options.label: B
options.text: Cognitive reserve is the ability to adapt and compensate for cognitive decline, and it can help prevent or delay the onset of Alzheimer's disease by creating new neural connections

options.label: C
options.text: Cognitive reserve is the ability to perform complex tasks, and it has no effect on Alzheimer's disease

options.label: D
options.text: Cognitive reserve is the ability to forget more information, and it can help prevent Alzheimer's disease by reducing the amount of cognitive decline

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Eating a healthy diet

options.label: D

options.label: C

options.label: B

multiple-choice.question: Why do biological males with an XY chromosome pair not have a problem with development?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they have two X chromosomes.

options.label: B
options.text: Because they have only one copy of all the X chromosome genes.

options.label: C
options.text: Because they have an extra Y chromosome.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they have a mutated X chromosome.

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of X inactivation in an embryo with two X chromosomes?

options.label: A
options.text: To create a problem for development.

options.label: B
options.text: To allow for the development of the embryo.

options.label: C
options.text: To turn off one X chromosome in each cell.

options.label: D
options.text: To activate both X chromosomes in each cell.

multiple-choice.question: Why do disorders associated with mutations of X chromosome genes tend to be less severe in individuals with two X chromosomes?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they have only one X chromosome.

options.label: B
options.text: Because in someone with one normal and one mutant copy of the gene, only some of their cells would be affected by the mutation.

options.label: C
options.text: Because they have a mutated Y chromosome.

options.label: D
options.text: Because they have a different version of the gene.

multiple-choice.question: What is still unresolved about X inactivation?

options.label: A
options.text: How genes on the X chromosome always get inactivated.

options.label: B
options.text: how some genes on the X chromosome escape inactivation.

options.label: C
options.text: why inactivation is always random.

options.label: D
options.text: why some cells inactivate one X chromosome and others inactivate the other.

title: What Can Herpes Do To Your Brain?

options.label: B
options.text: In the liver

options.label: C
options.text: In the neurons around the body

options.label: D
options.text: In the skin

options.label: B
options.text: A painful rash in particular locations on the skin, known as shingles

options.label: C
options.text: A fever and headache

options.label: D
options.text: A loss of appetite

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: A loss of the ability to recognize whole classes of things, such as animals or colors

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: To find a way to lure herpes out of the nervous system and stop all eight types of herpes in their tracks

options.label: D

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of a person who survives brain herpes and has lost the ability to recognize whole classes of things?

options.text: They become a skilled musician

options.label: C

title: How Magellan circumnavigated the globe - Ewandro Magalhaes

multiple-choice.question: What was the significance of the Treaty of Tordesillas?

options.label: A
options.text: It marked the beginning of the Spanish conquest of the Americas.

options.label: B
options.text: It divided the world into two hemispheres, with Spain claiming territories west of the divide and Portugal claiming territories east of the divide.

options.label: C
options.text: It established the Catholic Church as the dominant faith in Spain and Portugal.

options.label: D
options.text: It led to the colonization of the Spice Islands by Portugal.

multiple-choice.question: What was the primary goal of Ferdinand Magellan's voyage?

options.label: A
options.text: To establish a trade route to the Spice Islands through the Strait of Magellan.

options.label: B
options.text: To explore the coast of South America and find a passage linking east and west.

options.label: C
options.text: To convert the native populations of the Spice Islands to Christianity.

options.label: D
options.text: To establish a Spanish colony in Brazil.

multiple-choice.question: What was the reason for the mutiny on the Spanish armada?

options.label: A
options.text: The crew was dissatisfied with the leadership of Ferdinand Magellan.

options.label: B
options.text: The crew was unhappy with the lack of provisions and supplies.

options.label: C
options.text: The crew was resentful of having a Portuguese captain.

options.label: D
options.text: The crew was seeking to establish a new trade route.

multiple-choice.question: What was the outcome of the battle between Magellan's force and the native chief of Mactan?

options.label: A
options.text: Magellan's force emerged victorious, and the native chief was killed.

options.label: B
options.text: The native chief's force emerged victorious, and Magellan was killed.

options.label: C
options.text: The battle was a draw, and both sides suffered heavy losses.

options.label: D
options.text: The battle was not fought, and the native chief and Magellan negotiated a peace treaty.

multiple-choice.question: Who piloted the "Victoria" back to Spain after the death of Ferdinand Magellan?

options.label: A
options.text: Enrique, the young slave who had been freed by Magellan's will.

options.label: B
options.text: Antonio Pigafetta, the Venetian nobleman who had joined the expedition.

options.label: C
options.text: Juan Sebastián Elcano, one of the pardoned mutineers.

options.label: D
options.text: Rajah Humabon, the ruler of Cebu.
